titleStmt.title: J. N. Turner et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6490

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Princeton Kentucky
Govr Bramlette
Frankfort Ky

We the undersigned Union men Citizens ^of^ the Town of Princeton & county of Caldwell would earnestly & Respectfully ask of your Excellency If not incompatible with your feelings of duty that you pardon and acquit B. T. Gray and Charles Hooper ^& J. O. Hunter^ of the charges made in the (3) Indictments now pending in the Caldwell Circuit Court against them, Very Respectfully &c

J. N. Turner
Henry Tanay
Roger Tanay
Thomas Hunter
J. C. Barnes clk
Caldwell County Court
W T Talbott Police Judge
of the Town of Princeton
W H Kevil Trustee
Jury fund C C Ky
W. D. Marlow P. M.
A. Reynolds D. Shrff
James a. Carr M. D.
T. L. McNary M. D.

Petition of B. T. Gray
Charles Hooper & J. O.
Hunter -- to Govr
